question_text: Which of the following are characteristics of the DNS system? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Hierarchical structure with root, TLD, and authoritative servers
Resolves IP addresses to MAC addresses
Supports reverse lookups using PTR records
Caches query results for performance optimization
Operates as a centralized service hosted by a single ISP
correct_answer: Hierarchical structure with root, TLD, and authoritative servers
Supports reverse lookups using PTR records
Caches query results for performance optimization
explanation: DNS is hierarchical and distributed, supports forward and reverse lookups, and uses caching to reduce response time. It is not centralized, and resolving MAC addresses is handled by ARP, not DNS.
